p: Currently, the exact mechanisms by which vitamin D may reduce the severity of CD are still unclear. In a study using peripheral blood mononuclear cells, investigators found that vitamin D was able to reduce the expression of pro-inflammatory M1 cytokines but did not induce the anti-inflammatory M2 phenotype [ 195]. In other experimental studies, vitamin D deficiency, or even its impaired signaling, were shown to worsen different models of experimental colitis through multiple effects, including epithelial barrier disruption [ 196, 197], reduced mucosal immunity [ 198], and an association with gut dysbiosis [ 199, 200].
